segments.pli: “Chayime, bhikkhave, aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi, taṃ suṇātha … pe …
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you these six qualities that prevent decline. …

segments.pli: katame ca, bhikkhave, cha aparihāniyā dhammā?
segments.en: And what, mendicants, are the six qualities that prevent decline?

segments.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, na saṅgaṇikārāmatā, sovacassatā, kalyāṇamittatā—
segments.en: Not relishing work, talk, sleep, and company, being easy to admonish, and having good friends.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, cha aparihāniyā dhammā.
Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ na parihāyiṃsu kusalehi dhammehi, sabbete imeheva chahi dhammehi na parihāyiṃsu kusalehi dhammehi.
segments.en: Whether in the past, future, or present, all those who have not declined in skillful qualities do so because of these six qualities.”

segments.pli: Yepi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ na parihāyissanti kusalehi dhammehi, sabbete imeheva chahi dhammehi na parihāyissanti kusalehi dhammehi.
Yepi hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi na parihāyanti kusalehi dhammehi, sabbete imeheva chahi dhammehi na parihāyanti kusalehi dhammehī”ti.

sections.title: “Mendicants, I will teach you these six qualities that…

suttaplex.blurb: In the past, future, and present, practicing six good qualities protects against decline.
